TopicTitle: [1.0.5] RSS Planets & Moons expanded v0.12.0 Sedna is finally here!

Articles.Content:
> 
> Tried a lot of different settings, without any conclusive results. The blocky looking pqs will stay this way until a fix is found. Sorry. :/

            PQS        {            maxQuadLengthsPerFrame = 0.03            minLevel = 2            [B]maxLevel = 5[/B]            minDetailDistance = 8

that will fix it ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

your planets go from looking like [THIS](http://i.imgur.com/bwudT4D.png) to looking like [THIS](http://i.imgur.com/fiP8RZN.png). Reducing the maxLevel further will help smooth out terrain more, however at a cost of detail from the heightmap.

> 
> PQS        {            maxQuadLengthsPerFrame = 0.03            minLevel = 2            [B]maxLevel = 5[/B]            minDetailDistance = 8
> 
> 
> 
> 
> that will fix it ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
> 
> your planets go from looking like [THIS](http://i.imgur.com/bwudT4D.png) to looking like [THIS](http://i.imgur.com/fiP8RZN.png). Reducing the maxLevel further will help smooth out terrain more, however at a cost of detail from the heightmap.

I already tried. And it didn't make any difference ![:o](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_ohmy.png) that's what i don't understand
you can see the difference in the screenshots...did you remember to delete the .bin files? lowering it reducing the lines along the surface significantly

Oh, new celestial bodies look great! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

But isn't Ida longer IRL a bit?

> 
> Oh, new celestial bodies look great! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> But isn't Ida longer IRL a bit?

It is. I can't make it longer without making it "higher" since oblateness doesn't work well. So, it is a placeholder until oblateness works without bugs

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> you can see the difference in the screenshots...did you remember to delete the .bin files? lowering it reducing the lines along the surface significantly

You mean the cache files? I delete them every time I test something

**MINOR UPDATE**

0.4.1 : 

- Changed Saturn's texture

 - Changed saturn's ring diameter to match real values.

 - Changed Pan semi-major axis

 - Updated the orbital elements of all asteroids with more accurate values

 - Added RVE compatibility

Bug solved : Weird planet surfaces are no more!

Credits to Borisbee

> 
> ![OoLbVWG.png](http://i.imgur.com/OoLbVWG.png)
>

Launched a mission to Ida today. The rocked had 20560 m\s dV and was about 800.000 tons of wet mass ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

But that was great and Ida with Dactyl look just awesome in ScaledSpace!

But maybe it needs some tweaking for distance of switching between PQS and ScaledSpace? It looks a little weird at distance about 50.000 km ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![4U0hzqB.png](http://i.imgur.com/4U0hzqB.png)

- Added heightmaps to Pluto, Charon and Titania.

- Resized Pluto to a 4k map instead of a 8k. PM me if you want the 8k version.

- Added rings to Uranus
